intro: Malachra trinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined malachra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color.
